comment: I would recommend to take this course online and in the summer. There was homework but it wasn't too difficult.This class will be easy for those who have taken Spanish class before. There were writing and speaking assignments for discussion posts.The exams weren't bad if you do your homework. If you organize yourself, you will pass. Good Professor!
This is supposed to be an elementary Spanish class. The professor does not treat it as such.

Hard to "learn" in her online class because she doesn't do lectures, at least not for the summer class. If you don't know Spanish at all, this class may not make much sense. It's just doing the assignments in the txtbook. Not a bad class though

Good professor. Tests are not difficult if you keep up with the homework, but it's honestly not bad. She gives good feedback. Some discussions, easy short assignments.  She responds to emails fast. Would take again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly the content wasnt difficult, she just graded very difficult. It is an intro level class so honestly I dont understand why she was grading us like we should know this stuff. It was also online and she provided no lectures just online assignments so to me thats kind of unfair to grade so hard when its basically self taught.

I like Professor Garcia as a person but I would not take her online class again. Make sure you have the textbook as you will have to read. My biggest complaint is not having a clear structure of the class and the syllabus changes every week. The essays are confusing. I often left class not knowing what was going on at all.

Professor Garcia is so kind, caring, and hilarious! I chose to take her a second time, even though I did not get a great grade the first time because she is such a sweet lady. She cares about her students a lot, and is VERY willing to work with you if you communicate your needs to her. Her class set up can be confusing but you can succeed if you tr

Garcia can be nice, but I wouldn't take her online class again. It felt scattered and to be honest I cannot recall anything I learned. Her tests are hard because you don't know what to expect, she gives you good verbal feedback but then you're grade is like a low B on the test because you messed up a sentence it's a no for me.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: This professor is heartless and will let you fail. She doesn't care about her students or their grades. She doesn't teach, all of your work is on an online platform. She is TERRIBLE at emailing back. She submitted my final grades without out putting my final project. She's a liar and a terrible person. She's going to get her karma. Don't take!

Dr. Garcia is a gem! She cares about her students and wants them to learn Spanish. She gives clear instructions and prepares you for the oral exams. She also is willing to help you find study abroad and other opportunities to improve your Spanish. She also helps you find ways to save money on the textbook. PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND TAKE HER!

Beware this woman. Horrible, spotty lecture style. She jokes about being ADHD, then gives such scattered lectures you can't even figure out what's important. A lot of work. Two difficult tests over tons of material. If you don't give the exact answer she wants don't expect any credit. No original thoughts allowed!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read
